string.name: credits_text
string.translation_description: Please do not change the < and > markup

resources.string:
Support Development

Sky Map is free, open source, and ad-free. If you enjoy using it, please consider supporting continued development at our GitHub page.

Thank you to these folks who have recently donated!

%1$s

Credits

Original Engineering, Design and Product Management at Google

Brent Bryan, Dominic Widdows, Hector Ouilhet, James Powell, John Taylor, Kevin Serafini, Lior Ron

Engineering post-Google

John Taylor, Kevin Serafini

Open Source Contributors

Thank you to our open source contributors! %2$s

See the latest contributors on GitHub.

Acknowledgments

Sky Map was originally developed as "Google Sky Map" by Google Inc. and open sourced in 2012.

Sky Map uses maps derived from data from:

  • Centre de Donnees astronomiques de Strasbourg (https://cdsweb.u-strasbg.fr/)
  • The Bright Star Catalogue, 5th Revised Ed. (Hoffleit D., Warren Jr W.H.)
  • The HYG Database, HYG v1.0. (https://www.astronexus.com/)
  • History and Accurate Positions for the NGC/IC Objects (Harold G. Corwin Jr)
  • Revised New General Catalogue of Nonstellar Astronomical Objects (Sulentic J.W., Tifft W.G.)
  • SFA Star Charts (https://observe.phy.sfasu.edu/SFAStarCharts/SFAStarChartFAQ.html)
  • Positions of Solar System Objects are calculated from data provided by the USNO (https://www.usno.navy.mil/USNO/astronomical-applications)
  • Spherical coverage data obtained from (https://www2.research.att.com/~njas/coverings)
  • Hubble Images provided by NASA\'s Space Telescope Science Institute (https://hubblesite.org/)
  • 2024 Eclipse Map courtesy of NASA\'s Scientific Visualization Studio.
  • Meteor shower data from the International Meteor Organization (https://www.imo.net/data)
  • M31 image by Peter Kennett (https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:M31(Kennett).jpg)
  • Comet Leonard data: In-The-Sky.org
